definition: to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Caring about the customers concern and feeling.
sentences.chinese: 将心比心，关注客户的利益和感受。

sentences.english: You should feel for others. Don't be too harsh.
sentences.chinese: 你应当将心比心，别太苛刻了。

sentences.english: Thank them and send compliments their way.
sentences.chinese: 将心比心地感谢他们，赞美他们。

sentences.english: By putting yourself in her shoes, you will understand her feeling.
sentences.chinese: 将心比心，你就能了解她的心情。

definition: to put oneself in sb else's shoes
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to be lenient with others (idiom)
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
to exercise forbearance/patient and accommodating
where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2

definition: sincere/heartfelt/CL:片[pian4]
trouble/difficulty/problem
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
to give thought (to others)/to consider (other people's needs)/also pr. [zhao2 xiang3]
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
out of genuine friendship (idiom)/sincere feelings
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
